newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing debt market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing debt market report.

text.p: Dutch bonds lost all of the previous day's gains as they finished weaker on Friday with the long end of the yield curve bearing the brunt of the sell-off.
Dealers said guilder bonds started higher but the direction was swiftly reversed as bund futures failed to breach important resistance around 98.00.
"The longer end has come under a tiny bit of pressure," said a dealer, who sees Dutch bonds continuing their falls next week.
He said that with yield discounts to bunds in the 2003-2004 maturity range at nine to 12 basis points, Dutch bonds were overpriced against German equivalents.
Another dealer said volumes remained low, a situation not helped by the approaching weekend and British bank holiday on Monday.
But dealers reported good offshore buying in the 1999 and 2000 maturities, cushioning the effect of the sell-off w33n in the rest of the yield curve.
"They're (buyers) still expecting the short end to go lower," said one dealer.
They said a stronger than expected rise in U.S. durable goods orders in July did not help market sentiment.
